decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, and Immersturm Predator. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by stealing their creatures with Claim the Firstborn and sacrificing them for value with Woe Strider and Village Rites. The deck also utilizes cards like The Akroan War and Tymaret Calls the Dead to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, it focuses on dealing damage quickly while taking advantage of sacrificing and stealing mechanics.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, efficient creatures and disruption spells. By using the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den, the deck allows for recursion of key creatures, maintaining pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Selfless Savior provide protection for key creatures, while cards like Elite Spellbinder and Giant Killer disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on overwhelming control and disruption through a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and big threats. The deck aims to ramp into powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany to dominate the late game. With the support of ramp spells like Cultivate and Quandrix Cultivator, the deck can efficiently play its big threats like Elder Gargaroth and Polukranos, Unchained. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value with flicker effects and more powerful late-game plays. The deck utilizes a balanced mix of threats, disruption, and card advantage to outvalue opponents and control the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalker abilities. It also utilizes ramp spells to accelerate the mana base and access to powerful late-game threats and spells. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value and card advantage throughout the game. With a mix of creature threats, board wipes, and versatile removal options, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the pace of the game until it can establish a dominant position and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build a board presence of powerful green creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck focuses on playing efficient, cost-effective creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Stonecoil Serpent, backed up by powerful finishers like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Questing Beast. The abundance of mana acceleration cards like Castle Garenbrig and Tangled Florahedron allows the deck to quickly ramp up and play its big threats ahead of schedule. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a fast and efficient aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on using sacrifice effects and stealing opponent's creatures to control the board while dealing damage quickly. By utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Village Rites, the deck aims to generate value from sacrificing creatures like Serrated Scorpion and Woe Strider. Extus, Oriq Overlord and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provide powerful threats that can quickly end the game, while cards like Bastion of Remembrance and The Akroan War help chip away at the opponent's life total. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence through sacrifice synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing the cycling mechanic to consistently draw cards and deal damage to the opponent. The goal is to cycle through the deck quickly to dig for key cards like Zenith Flare, while also triggering abilities like Valiant Rescuer and Improbable Alliance to generate additional value. By cycling through the deck efficiently and applying pressure with the Aggro strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage and direct damage to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and combat tricks to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. By curving out with low-cost creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Giant Killer, as well as generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Cards like Showdown of the Skalds help to refuel the hand and provide additional threats on the board. The mana base is well-balanced to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

The main idea behind this deck is to have a fast and aggressive playstyle with a focus on sacrificing creatures for value and dealing damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Eyetwitch and Serrated Scorpion for early game pressure, while also utilizing cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger for additional disruption and damage. The deck also includes sacrifice outlets like Woe Strider and Plumb the Forbidden to generate more value from sacrificing creatures, ultimately aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through mill and disruption while using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value. By milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and disrupting their plays with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal like Eliminate, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through card advantage with Into the Story. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both blue and black mana sources for casting spells efficiently.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate value and out-value opponents in the long game. The deck includes a variety of powerful control tools such as Elder Gargaroth, Quandrix Cultivator, Emergent Ultimatum, and a host of removal spells like Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict. The deck aims to control the board and grind out incremental advantages over opponents, eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats and efficient removal. With plenty of ways to generate card advantage and disrupt opponents' game plans, this deck excels in controlling the game's pace and coming out ahead in the late game.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate value from blinking permanents for card advantage and board control. It aims to ramp quickly with Cultivate and Quandrix Cultivator, while also using removal spells like Heartless Act and Extinction Event to control the board. Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany provide powerful win conditions, while cards like Elder Gargaroth and Binding the Old Gods offer additional value and flexibility. The deck also includes counterspells and strong planeswalkers like Kiora Bests the Sea God for extra control options.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while milling them out with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber. By utilizing cards like Drown in the Loch and Into the Story, you can control the board and draw cards to keep up the pressure. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion to provide additional value by recurring small creatures and pump spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until you can win by decking your opponent out.

The key concept of this deck is to dominate and control the game through mill, disruption, and card advantage. By using cards like Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Drown in the Loch, and Into the Story, the objective is to mill the opponent's deck while also disrupting their plays with counterspells and removal spells. The combination of creatures like Soaring Thought-Thief and Merfolk Windrobber with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for a strong board presence while maintaining control over the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a strong board presence and then finish off opponents with Zenith Flare. The deck includes cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger to cycle through the deck efficiently, while also utilizing cards like Valiant Rescuer and Improbable Alliance to create token creatures. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and the powerful Zenith Flare spell. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Neutralize and Frostveil Ambush to disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize cards with cycling abilities to quickly cycle through the deck, trigger effects like Zenith Flare, and create tokens with cards like Valiant Rescuer and Improbable Alliance. By constantly cycling cards, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of low-cost spells and creatures, while also maintaining card advantage and flexibility in play. The deck also includes cards like Drannith Stinger and Irencrag Pyromancer to deal direct damage to the opponent, making it a fast-paced aggro deck with a focus on cycling synergies.
